meanings.definition: A soluble gelatinous polysaccharide present in ripe fruits, used as a gelling agent in jams and jellies.
meanings.sent1: The pectins in the jam made it thick and spreadable.
meanings.sent2: I added pectins to the fruit mixture to make delicious jelly.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids tried to use pectins to glue their toys together.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a binding power, like pectins holding fruit cells together.
meanings.sent5: The pectins formed a sticky web, trapping the flavors in the jam.

meanings.definition: A substance that occurs in the cell walls of plants, especially fruits, and helps to bind cells together.
meanings.sent1: The pectins in the apple helped maintain its shape and structure.
meanings.sent2: Fruits like apples contain pectins that give them their firmness.
meanings.sent3: The pectins in the orange peel seemed to be playing a game of cell wall tag.
meanings.sent4: The pectins acted like tiny hands, holding the plant cells together.
meanings.sent5: The pectins were like invisible glue, keeping the fruit intact.
